page.title: 06 "No Messages"
page.content: The disparate nature of block 05040432 is noway better illustrated than by a spatial mapping of the density of graffiti and its concomitant vandalism. Go around Cottingham and you will find some if you look hard enough. After all graffiti writers are as old as history and historically the pictures are written messages of the life of the times. Then go north and east from Cottingham towards the newer {Council Estates}and it becomes less of a search. Through North Hull and towards Orchard Park the wall messages begin to jump out at you. No longer is there the need to search. So Cottingham youth does not feel the urge to write all over? Why is this so? Certainly Orchard Park lays claim to be one of the four most{deprived Council Estates in the country. In contrast affluence rules in Cottingham
